msContents.summary: Fragment A, Column 1: Thucydides 4.28.4 Fragment A, Column 2: Thucydides 4.29.3 Fragment B, Column 4: Thucydides 4.32.1 Fragment C, Column 5: Thucydides 4.32.4 Fragment C, Column 6: Thucydides 4.33.2 Fragment C, Column 7: Thucydides 4.34.3 Fragment C, Column 8: Thucydides 4.36.2

msItemStruct.note: Text (on all fragments) is on one side only. Total number of lines for all three fragments is 102.
Fragment A: Column 1 (28.4) is 2 lines written against the fibers. Column 2 (29.3) is 5 lines written against the fibers.
Fragment B: Column 4 (32.1) is 14 lines written with the fibers.

Fragment C: Column 5 (32.4) is 8 lines written with the fibers. Column 6 (33.2) is 26 lines written with the fibers. Column 7 (34.3) is 31 lines written with the fibers. Column 8 (36.2) is 16 lines written with the fibers.
Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology collection

supportDesc.support: Fragment A: 2.7 x 5.0cm. Fragment B: 2.8 x 6.8cm. Fragment C: 20.5 x 14.8cm. (Smallest fragment, unlabeled: 2.3 x 4.5cm) Four fragments consisting of portions of six columns. These fragments are part of the same work as P. Oxy 1.16. (E02747)

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt (1903) on behalf of the Egyptian Exploration Fund, and donated to the University Museum in return for its support (1907, Dr. Parrish Collection).

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

listBibl.bibl: P. Oxy. 4.696 John R. Abercrombie, "The University Museum's Collection of Papyri and Related Materials," Expedition 20.2 (Winter 1978): 32-37.
